Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: SailingPT
Reviews.Content: The Meininger has everything you'd want from a city hotel: easy to come and go as you please, hassle-free reception. It has a very nice kitchen, which we were free to use for meals. We prepared breakfast there every day, and stored our food in the fridges available. The room was excellent: we got a mezzanine room. The bathroom was spectacular: small, but with a very powerful shower! It is in a very friendly neighbourhood, with plenty of little shops and very good restaurants, where locals go to eat. Every night, there were prostitutes on the street, and there is a strip bar across the road (right next to the cash machine), but neither detracted from the cosy feeling of the neighbourhood. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JenniferBehan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a private room in this hotel. It was spotlessly clean with a lovely bathroom and shower. Excellent location (metro outside door), friendly staff, good breakfast. Very comfortable stay for such low prices. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hostel, one of the best I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: amp1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 4 nights last week, and could't have been more happy with my stay. Obviously very recently renovated, the rooms and sheets were clean, and the bathroom was fantastic. The room had lockers for each person staying in there, which needed your own lock. Mine was unfortunately too small, so be careful about that if you do like to keep your things locked away. The packed lunch they provide for 4euros was excellent value for money, and the breakfast was nice and convenient, much cheaper than other places in the area. Honestly one of the nicest hostels I've stayed in, definitely felt more like a hotel than a hostel. Location was excellent aswell. Will be keeping an eye out for Meininger hostels each time I travel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap with good location”
Reviews.Author: Buskachi
Reviews.Content: Clean, functional and simple rooms with in an excellent location with walking distance to most major sights and tram and subway within 50 metres.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and furnishing, but bad use of space”
Reviews.Author: VarvaraK
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: right there in Mitte, next to Museuminsel, shopping streets, cafes, bars and superb restaurants. Hotel is either new or newly renovated. Stylish furnishing. One can really see that the interior was thought through carefully. Bathroom: clean and stylish as everything else, but quite cold. So the towels weren’t dry in the morning. BUT: - For some reason I was asked to pay beforehand. We were staying just for three nights, so it didn’t bother me much at the moment. - The double room was incredibly small: there were two beds (put together to make it a double bed), one sofa (Danish design, good looking) and a tiny rack, where we could only put our coats. There was no place to put our suitcases, so they blocked half the space. All our clothes covered the beautiful design sofa, never giving us a chance to sit on it. For three days we could take it. But I can’t imagine staying there longer. - Breakfast: useless way to spend your 5 euro. So called juice made from some powder - tasted very chemical and too sweet to be real. I found it much more enjoyable to have my breakfast in a café not far from the hotel. Besides, breakfast in Meininger lasts until 10 a.m. – and that’s way too early! - Checking out: they have an early check out at 10 a.m. But there’s an option to prolong your stay for 5 euro – so was written in the hotel card they give you. But it turned out, that it’s not 5 euro per room, but 5 euro per person. It’s not the kind of money to go grumble about, but I at that point I was just too tired of this attitude: “We are such a great place to stay! Yoo-hoo! We are the best!” and then they just charge you for every little thing… I mean, you’re either a cheap hostel-like thing or a “design hotel in cool location”. And once you call yourself a design hotel, I expect not to be charged for some rubbish every single time. So, I don’t think I am coming back there.

Reviews.Title: “first time & impressive”
Reviews.Author: sharkyja
Reviews.Content: That was the first time that I came to Berlin and also use Meininger chain hotel brand. I love Berlin and also love Meininger. I hope that I will enjoy every Meininger. Impressive. The under ground station is next door but hotel is quietime , new , large room and bath room, clean. There was everything I need. (you can use kitchen also at downstair) , Staffs were friendly and helpful. This hotle is near many attractions! and easy to go everywhere in Berlin. Great time in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,clean,space,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: antonio_reth
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for one night and it was perfect.My room 225 was big enough,clean with a huge nice bathroom.There is a 24h front desk-bar that you can have your drink or snack 24h a day.The hotel is outside the metro station and tram stop also and near to all sightseeings on foot.Us you come out the hotel in your left hand you can find a building seizure by artists and it's a must see in Berlin.After 20:00 the street is full of hookers but not unsafe at all.The area is very safe,the hotel cheap,clean.I recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated”
Reviews.Author: Gaetano_Aliberti
Reviews.Content: I spent two dayscould get everywhere in the city because hotel is near the S-Bahn line. Room was clean but was not possible to regolate the temperature: air cooling system was always on. People at reception are young but very professional. The only think I don't like is the breakfast. Breakfast room is too small, no possibility to have a real cappuccino or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Superb low cost in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Grauthue
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy! Nice breakfast. The perfect hotel for anyone who basically is just looking for a place to sleep. WiFi in the lobby could as well been free in the rooms. The receptionist could also be a little more uptodate on everything else than Facebook.

Reviews.Title: “A miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: Tim-and-his-family
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very unprofessional. On the first night of our stay at about 11:30 we were awakened by knocking. The door opened before we could get dressed, so we had to confront two guys in our underwear. One said he was staff (though he wore no uniform or tag), the other guy was a guest who had stayed in the room the night before and had locked some belongings in a locker in the room -- he wanted them back. After arguing with them for a while, we let the guy take his stuff and leave. The staff guy was apologetic, but indicated he had no choice. The episode was so weird we sat for a while wondering if it had been some sort of scam, but I don't think it was -- it was an awkward situation that was terribly handled by the hotel staff. Besides this late-night episode, we noted that the staff was very rude, like they normally deal with stag party groups and testy bargain travelers. We found the room very uncomfortable -- it was poorly ventilated. The evenings were cool, but the room stayed about 82F (I had a thermometer). We could only crack the windows a little by tilting them in, they had special locks to keep them from fully opening. The staff said this is a safety mechanism -- presumably to keep the drunken guests from tumbling out the windows. It was safe, but made us miserable. The hotel looks brand new with nice furnishings, but the mattresses were thin and lumpy. The bedding was not clean when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “New and clean hotel, perfect for travellers!”
Reviews.Author: MattiaQuinteri
Reviews.Content: A brand new hotel, opened just few months ago. It is in a very good location to visit the most interesting places of the city and to experience the nightlife in Berlin. I stayed there for 4 days with friends in a dorm room: the sheets were very clean, the bathroom modern, the room was cleaned up daily and the beds were quite comfortable. The only problem was that the room was located on the first floor in front of the street and the noise could be annoying. The atmosphere is lively and warm. The staff is young, kind and polite and this balances a little lack of experience. In the lobby you can use free wifi connection while you are sitting on couches and sofas, or pay to use the computers of the hotel. There is also a kitchen with all facilities, very useful to save money, and a courtyard. It's very easy to chat and meet people from the all world in these common places. To visit the city you can take the S-Bahn in the station in front of the hotel (Oranienburg Tor) and at night there are many pubs and restaurants. At night there are also prostitutes nearby, but they don't bother you at all. At last, the prices are cheap and the value is really good. Perfect for travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but location might be a problem”
Reviews.Author: TSDgeos
Reviews.Content: The hotel has just opened one or two months ago and it shows, everything is new, nice and shiny. There is paid wifi in the rooms and free wifi in the reception area that is fitted with nice comfy sofas. The location is very close to the museum island and in a street with lots of bars and restaurants but for some people it might be a problem since there is a relatively high quantity of prostitutes in that area of the street. They are not aggressive nor they are naked but might be an issue for some kind of people. Otherwise totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel very clean”
Reviews.Author: jocooper
Reviews.Content: lovely clean and modern room just a bit on the small size for 3 people

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Idylla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new, very clean and tidy. It's right at an S-Bahn station and central East Berlin. It's within a walking distance from Alexander Platz and Brandenburger Tor and just opposite C/O Berlin. There are lots of restaurants and cafes around. The only dowside is that some room face the Oranienburger Strasse which can be noisy during night. I didn't mind that and had no problems with sleeping. The value for money was great and will stay there again when I visit Berlin. I also would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “new no frills hotel - excellent location and value - in the party zone of "Mitte"”
Reviews.Author: joe1968
Reviews.Content: Just having opened June 2011 the location is biggest advantage: the S-Bahn is in front of the door, many attractions reachable by foot, streetside restaurants&cafes and night clubs are adjacent. Rooms are no frills but (as brand new) very good value: modern bathroom with shower (fluid soap provided), linen was excellent, matress will be worn soon. Service is limited as this also works as a hostel for bigger groups (dormitory) Free internet in lobby only, free parking is difficult to find in the area (7/7 charged) Please not that this place in the main party zone of Mitte for young "smokers" and long-legged girls with short skirts are walking up and down the pavements at night... if you are over 25 you'll make the difference in this area. If you room faces to the back courtyard: there is always a loud crowd from the nearby other hostel (when drunk they make a lot of noise)
